Timer.capacity

Function/Meaning
Maximum event capacity
Type
Property of Timer class (read/write)
Description
Specifies how many events can be generated at once. You can also set this value.
There are cases where timer events cannot be processed in time, such as when a process takes longer than the timer interval. In this case, the timer stores events in the event queue, but there is a limit to the number of events that can be stored in that queue. This property specifies that maximum number.
When it comes time to process events, Kirikiri attempts to process the number of events accumulated in the queue at once.
If 1 is specified, a maximum of only 1 event will accumulate in the event queue. If 0 is specified, there is no limit to the number of events that can accumulate in the event queue, but be aware that if too many events accumulate, the application may appear to freeze.
The default is 6.
